cnbc.title: Apple has its best week since July 2020 after White House visit
cnbc.summary: Apple is the third-most valuable company, behind Microsoft and Nvidia and ahead of Google and Amazon.

cnbc.title: Gold futures trade off highs as White House to issue clarification on bullion tariffs
cnbc.summary: Gold prices fell from a record high Friday after the White House said it will clarify "misinformation" about the precious metal facing tariffs.

cnbc.title: Trump says he will meet with Putin in Alaska on Aug. 15
cnbc.summary: Washington's deadline for Moscow to strike a ceasefire in Ukraine was slated to expire on Friday.

cnbc.title: Intel CEO responds to 'misinformation' and Trump threat in letter to employees
cnbc.summary: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan addressed "misinformation" about his previous roles on Thursday after President Donald Trump called for his resignation.

cnbc.title: Trade Desk tanks 39% for worst day ever on CFO departure and competition from Amazon
cnbc.summary: The Trade Desk beat on earnings and revenue, but the stock was headed for its worst day on record as investors worried about rising competition from Amazon.

cnbc.title: Trump warns courts against knocking down tariffs, says duties are 'huge positive' for stock market
cnbc.summary: The president said a tariff reversal could cause a Great Depression-style economic crisis.

cnbc.title: Tesla Robotaxi scores permit to run ride-hailing service in Texas
cnbc.summary: Tesla obtained a permit to run a ride-hailing service, in Texas, allowing it to join a market that includes Uber, Lyft and others.

cnbc.title: Bed Bath & Beyond relaunches with first store in Nashville, plans dozens more
cnbc.summary: Bed Bath & Beyond has been resurrected after filing for bankruptcy in 2023 and liquidating. Its new owners are looking to open dozens of stores through 2026.

cnbc.title: The winners and losers in tech's AI-powered ad race
cnbc.summary: Ad revenue has stayed strong amid broader macroeconomic uncertainty due to President Donald Trump's tough tariffs and the closing of the de minimis loophole.

cnbc.title: Sweetgreen shares drop 23% after salad chain cuts outlook for the second time in two quarters
cnbc.summary: Sweetgreen said it saw issues with its loyalty program, weak consumer sentiment, tariff headwinds and store challenges.
